w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic actions around the house by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: actions, house, pick up toys, make the bed, vacuum, This is the kitchen/my room/laundry room, I can pick up toys in my room, I can make the bed in my room, I can vacuum my room, I can wash dishes, I can set the table, I can mop and sweep the floor, I can wash clothes in the laundry room, I can fold clothes in the laundry room
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for action words around the house
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: wash, sweep, mop, fold
This slide will always be the Naativ-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about actions around the house!
Listen to your teacher say the poem about a
Read the poem to the child. Emphasize and circle the word,
each time you read it. Clear the screen and complete this step again with the help of the child.
Circle a picture of an action at a time and do the action while saying the word,
Encourage the student to join in.
Circle the picture of the bedroom and say,
I can pick up toys in my room (
and circle the girl picking up toys.
Visual cue: Have a few small toys beside you. Pick them up and say
with the action. Encourage the child to repeat.
Underline the first part of the bolded sentence and say it with the action. Then underline the second part of the bolded sentence and say it. Clear the screen and have the child repeat.
I can make the bed in my room (
and circle the girl making the bed.
Visual cue: Have a toy bed out to show the child. Have a small blanket or cloth and pretend to make the bed.
with the action of pretending to lay a blanket out on a bed. Encourage the child to repeat.
Underline the first part of the bolded sentence and say it with the action. Then underline the second part of the bolded sentence and say it. Clear the screen and have the child repeat.
I can vacuum in my room
Visual cue: If possible, have a real vacuum out to show the student.
with the action of pretending to move a vacuum around with a humming sound. Encourage the child to repeat.
Underline the first part of the bolded sentence and say it with the action. Then underline the second part of the bolded sentence and say it. Clear the screen and have the child repeat.
Draw a line from the picture to the correct column in belongs in.

Model drawing a line from the toy car to the column,
. Encourage the child to complete the other two pictures and say the words or phrases that go with.
vacuum, pick up, make the bed,
one at a time. Have the child do the action for each word or phrase.
Circle the picture of the kitchen and say,
I can set the table in the kitchen.
and circle the boy setting the plates on the table.
Visual cue: Have an actual cup, plate and fork to pretend to
with the action of pretending to put plates, cups and silverware on the table. Encourage the child to repeat.
Underline the first part of the bolded sentence and say it with the action. Then underline the second part of the bolded sentence and say it. Clear the screen and have the child repeat.
I can mop and sweep in the kitchen.
and circle the mop and broom.
Visual cue: If possible, have an actual broom to show this better.
with the action of pretending to move a mop or broom around. Encourage the child to repeat.
Underline the first part of the bolded sentence and say it with the action. Then underline the second part of the bolded sentence and say it. Clear the screen and have the child repeat.
I can wash dishes in the kitchen.
and circle the plate being washed.
Visual cue: If possible, have an actual washcloth and plate and pretend to wash it.
with the action of pretending to wash a plate. Encourage the child to repeat.
Underline the first part of the bolded sentence and say it with the action. Then underline the second part of the bolded sentence and say it. Clear the screen and have the child repeat.
do the action and say the phrase
the floor, do the action and say the phrase

Ask the child, “Where do you wash dishes?” Ask them to circle the place. If they need help, circle the answer for them.
Ask the child, “Where do you sweep and mop?” Encourage the child to circle the floor.
Ask the child, “Where do you set the table?” Encourage the child to circle the table.
Circle the picture of the laundry room and say,
I can wash clothes in the laundry room.
and circle the washer with water in it.
with the action of moving your hand the way clothes move in a washer to show how the washer moves the clothes around. Encourage the child to repeat.
Underline the first part of the bolded sentence and say it with the action. Then underline the second part of the bolded sentence and say it. Clear the screen and have the child repeat.
I can fold clothes in the laundry room.
and circle the clothes that are folded and the girl folding one.
Visual cue: If possible, have an actual washcloth and pretend to fold it.
with the action of pretending to fold a washcloth. Encourage the child to repeat.
Underline the first part of the bolded sentence and say it with the action. Then underline the second part of the bolded sentence and say it. Clear the screen and have the child repeat.
Write the missing verb (fold and wash)
Underline the first sentence. Ask the child what is missing. Do the action for
on the blank. Do the next sentence the same way.
Draw a line from the action to the place you do the action and say the complete phrase.
Model drawing a line from the washer to the laundry room. Say the complete phrase:
I wash clothes in the laundry room.
Encourage the child to do the same with the other two picture sets.
Say the action word for each picture
and then circle the first picture. Encourage the child to finish the phrase. Repeat with all the pictures.
